intro: Bignonia auriculigera, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring opposite, heart-shaped leaves and long, slender stems. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Bignonia auriculigera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
